title.narrative: COMPRENHENSIVE CARE MECHANISM CHILD-MATE

description.narrative: By September 2015, decision makers have acquired political and technical guidelines that improve comprehensive early childhood care at institutional, community and family level., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Hygiene, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By September 2015, children, adolescents and women in situation of inequality and exclusion, have access to social services of higher quality.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By September 2015, decision makers have acquired political and technical guidelines that improve comprehensive early childhood care at institutional, community and family level.
BCG and Hepatitis B vaccination coverage in 10 municipalities

baseline.value: Coverage 2011 BCG - Hepatitis B: Arjona:42.4 - 82.0. Magangue:114.4 - 101.5. Mahates:39.9 - 80.8. Buenos Aires: 67.3 - 96.9. Santander de Quilichao: 97.5 - 102.7. Suarez: 85.1 - 97.9. Montelibano: 105.1 - 99.3. Puerto Libertador: 76.0 - 95.1. Dibulla: 22.5 - 98.6. Maure: 46 - 65.1

title.narrative: Percentage of antenatal care (ANC) medical records with evidence of the following activities: 1) syphilis screening, 2) HIV screening, 3) hepatitis B screening, 4) measurement of fundal height curve and 5) immunization with anti-tetanus vaccine.
Percentage of education institutions (EI) in 3 rural municipalities adopting hand washing with soap practices

baseline.value: In 2011 10% of EI in northern Cauca have adopted hand washing with soap.Santander de Quilichao has 20 rural EI and Buenos Aires has 9 rural EI

target.value: 2014:At least 25% of rural EI from 3 municipalities adopting hand washing with soap practices

actual.value: 2015:Achieved. Seventy two percent (72%) of schools from 2 municipalities (Santander de Quilichao, Buenos Aires). In Manaure started to adopt the practice of washing hands with soap and water at critical times in 10 EI

title.narrative: Number of educational agents, leaders who acquire or strengthen knowledge to guide families in integral early childhood care - thirteen key practices.

baseline.value: To 2011 in each municipality, between 500 and 800 educational agents and leaders, have been trained, but not in all thirteen key practices.5.407 community agents from 9 municipalities of Choco department have guided 2,184 families on comprehensive early childhood care.

title.narrative: Number of local level validated tools adopted at national level as part of the early childhood comprehensive care strategy: 1. Public policy guidelines for rural water and sanitation and risk management associated with drinking water and basic sanitation. 2. mechanisms to remove barriers to access civil registration (CR) for indigenous populations at health care institution. 3. The route to access micronutrients at the departmental level. 4.intercultural guideline for comprehensive care in early

baseline.value: Tools' initial situation 1. No tools are currently available. 2. There is information about the barriers of access civil registration at health care institutions in La Guajira, Choco, Nari?o and Valle del Cauca departments. 3. A general MOH guideline to overcome micronutrient deficiencies is available. 4.0, 5.0, 6.0
